Obscene Publications (Amendment) Act, No. 22 of 1983 (Certified on Sth July, 1989] LD.—O 110/78. . AN Act To AMEND THE OssceNE Pueuications Onoranct BE it enacted by the Parliament of the Democratic Socialist Republic of Sri Lanka as follows :—
1. This Act may be cited as the Obscene Publications Shert title. (Amendment) Act, No. 22 of 1983,

2, Section 2 of the Obscene Publications Ordinance is Amenimont hereby repested and the following new section substituted $f Usnter‘s, therefor :— poirot 2 It shall be an offence against this iSebacene Ordinance punishable on conviction by @
1) for the first offence, with a fine not exceeding two thousand rupees oF imprisonment of either description for a term not exceeding six months, or with both such fine and imprisonment; and

(@) for a subsequent offence committed after a conviction for the first offence, with imprisonment of either descrip- tion for a term not exceeding six months and in addition with 2 fine hot exceeding two thousand rupees,
to do any of the following acts namely :—

(@) for purposes of or by way of trade or for distribution or publie exhibition to make or produce or have in pomession for purposes stated or otherwise, obscene writings, draw- ings, prints, paintings,“ printed matter, pictures, posters, emblems, photographs, cinematograph films, video cassettes or any other obscene objects ;

2 Obscene Publications (Amendment) Act, No. 22 of 1983 {b) for the purposes above mentioned to . import, convey, or export or cause fo be imported, conveyed, or : exported any of the said obscene matiers ot things, or in any manner whatsoever to put them into efreulation ;

(c) to carry on or take part in a business, whether public or private, concerned with any of the said obscene matters or things, or to deal in the said matters or things in any manner whatsoever, or to distribute them or to exhibit them publicly or to make a business of lending them :
